title: Costco workers reveal 33 things they'd love to tell shoppers, but can't
text:
Costco membership can go to some people's heads, according to workers.

Business Insider reached out to 49 Costco employees to find out what they wish they could tell shoppers but can't.

Common requests were to control your kids, hang up your phone, and help unload the cart.

Visit Business Insider's homepage for more stories.

Costco membership comes with some obvious perks — namely, access to the retail chain and its food court.

But according to dozens of Costco workers who spoke with Business Insider, being a member doesn't entitle you to do whatever you want.

While Costco made Glassdoor's list of best places to work this year, employees still had several complaints about shoppers' rude and inconvenient behavior.

Business Insider spoke to 50 Costco employees about the things they want to tell members but can't. Some of their responses focused on obvious problems, like members being mean and inconsiderate. But some of the tips could help you save time or money on your next Costco run.

Here's what they had to say.
description: Costco membership doesn't entitle you to do whatever you want in the store, and employees say they'd prefer if people refrained from these behaviors.
